sn22.11:4.2: “Mendicants, form of the past and future is not-self,
sn22.11:4.4: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about past form,
sn22.11:4.5: doesn’t look forward to enjoying future form,
sn22.11:4.6: and they practice for the disillusionment, fading away, and cessation of present form.
sn22.11:4.10: Consciousness of the past and future is impermanent,
sn22.11:4.12: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about past consciousness,
sn22.11:4.13: doesn’t look forward to enjoying future consciousness,
sn22.11:4.14: and they practice for the disillusionment, fading away, and cessation of present consciousness.”
